result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R. Dura was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs, service fees, and $150 buy money--  Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms

No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled susbtances without a valid prescription.
No contact with anyone known to use, possess, or sell illegal drugs

Comply with the COMPAS assessment and any resulting recommendations made by agent.
Payment of all Court ordered financial obligations and DOC supervision fees.
Def must submit a DNA sample 12-13-17

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph R. Dura

records.addlTxt: DOC amendment to JOC and order - def has successfully completed the Earned Release Program

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph R. Dura in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10am
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms 
Court questions affidavit of mailing of discovery to Atty Crowell 
Atty Hansen states did receive that discovery
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
4 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP & SAP.
Conditions of E.S:
Pay costs, $72 SF, and $150 buy money--  Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.  
Obtain GED or HSED
No possession or consumption of alcohol or  controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with anyone known to use, possess, or sell illegal drugs
Comply with the COMPAS assessment and any resulting recommendations made by agent
Payment of all Court ordered financial obligations and DOC supervision fees
Def must submit DNA sample today
Def remanded into custody of MSD
Appeal rights
